summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for July 13, 2019, detailing routine prison operations, counts, and security checks. It notes inmates on psychological observation and suicide watch, and references an inmate transfer order from a Captain Darden. The logs cover three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch) and show standard institutional procedures.

persons.name: Captain Darden
persons.context: Mentioned as the authority who ordered an inmate transfer to the Hospital Annex (HA) due to no bed space in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Inmate Transfer to Hospital Annex
events.description: An inmate was transferred to the Hospital Annex (HA) because there was no bed space available in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), as per the order of Captain Darden.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log documents prison operations on July 13, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell (though his name is not explicitly mentioned in this text).
Multiple inmates are noted as being on psychological observation and suicide watch with inmate companions.
An inmate was transferred to the Hospital Annex on the order of Captain Darden due to a lack of space in the SHU.
Some inmates were at a local hospital or nursing facility under guard by the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS).
The logs show routine security procedures, including body alarm tests, inmate counts, and equipment checks, across three shifts.
